courses.name: Circuits and Systems
courses.description: An introduction to the analysis and design of electrical circuits and systems, including linear and nonlinear circuits, transient and steady-state response, and frequency domain analysis.

courses.name: Signals and Systems
courses.description: A study of continuous and discrete signals, system representation, and analysis techniques in the time and frequency domains.

courses.name: Electromagnetics
courses.description: An introduction to the theory and applications of electromagnetism, including Maxwell's equations, wave propagation, and electromagnetic devices.

courses.name: Control Systems
courses.description: A study of control system design, including feedback control, stability analysis, and state-space representations.

courses.name: Digital Systems
courses.description: An introduction to digital systems design, including combinatorial and sequential circuits, memory elements, and state machines.

courses.name: Electronic Devices and Circuits
courses.description: A study of electronic devices and their application in electrical circuits, including diodes, bipolar junction transistors, and field-effect transistors.

courses.name: Communication Systems
courses.description: An introduction to the design and analysis of communication systems, including analog and digital communication, modulation and demodulation, and error correction coding.

courses.name: Power Systems
courses.description: A study of power system analysis and design, including power flow, fault analysis, and stability.

courses.name: Computer Architecture
courses.description: An introduction to computer architecture, including instruction sets, computer arithmetic, and memory hierarchy.

courses.name: VLSI Design
courses.description: A study of very-large-scale integration (VLSI) design, including CMOS design, digital integrated circuit design, and computer-aided design (CAD) tools.

courses.name: Analog and Digital Signal Processing
courses.description: A study of signal processing techniques, including filtering, transformation, and spectral analysis for both analog and digital signals.
